cluster_classes.class_description: Families of stainless steels categorized by their dominant metallurgical structure: austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic stainless steels are specific families within stainless steels.

cluster_classes.class_description: Metallurgical structures found in steels, including austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic are metallurgical structures in steels.

cluster_classes.class_description: Metallurgical structure characterized by austenite, found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic are metallurgical structures in steels.

members.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (austenite) found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys, known for its corrosion resistance.

cluster_classes.class_description: Metallurgical structure characterized by ferrite, found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic are metallurgical structures in steels.

members.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (ferrite) found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.

cluster_classes.class_description: Metallurgical structure characterized by martensite, found in some stainless steels.

members.entity_description: A metallurgical structure (martensite) found in some stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.

members.entity_description: 300 Series stainless steels including Types 304, 304L, 304H, 309, 310, 316, 316L, 316H, 321, 321H, 347, and 347H.

cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic stainless steels are specific families within stainless steels.

members.entity_description: A family of stainless steels including Types 405, 409, 430, 442, and 446.

cluster_classes.class_description: Stainless steels with martensitic structure, including Types 410, 410S, 416, 420, 440A, 440B, and 440C.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic stainless steels are specific families within stainless steels.

members.entity_description: A type of stainless steel that includes Types 410, 410S, 416, 420, 440A, 440B, and 440C.

splits.name: Austenitic Structure
splits.description: Metallurgical structure characterized by austenite, found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys.

splits.name: Ferritic Structure
splits.description: Metallurgical structure characterized by ferrite, found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels.

splits.name: Martensitic Structure
splits.description: Metallurgical structure characterized by martensite, found in some stainless steels.

args.justification: ClsC_297a52fd is overloaded, grouping distinct metallurgical structures (austenitic, ferritic, martensitic) that are already represented as separate classes; splitting clarifies schema and avoids redundancy.

args.new_description: Metallurgical structure characterized by austenite, found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys.
args.justification: ClsR_aed0d686 and SPLIT_Austenitic_Structure are duplicates, both representing the austenitic metallurgical structure with identical entity membership and description.

args.new_description: Metallurgical structure characterized by ferrite, found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels.
args.justification: ClsR_ed9c5658 and SPLIT_Ferritic_Structure are duplicates, both representing the ferritic metallurgical structure with identical entity membership and description.

args.new_description: Metallurgical structure characterized by martensite, found in some stainless steels.
args.justification: ClsR_423fb320 and SPLIT_Martensitic_Structure are duplicates, both representing the martensitic metallurgical structure with identical entity membership and description.

args.new_description: Families of stainless steels categorized by their dominant metallurgical structure: austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic.
args.justification: ClsC_17b175d2 represents families of stainless steels, which is a broader classification than metallurgical structures; assigning a more precise Class_Group clarifies schema.

args.new_description: Stainless steels with austenitic structure, including 300 Series types.
args.justification: ClsR_8e6e239d is a family of stainless steels defined by austenitic structure; grouping under 'Stainless Steel Classification' aligns with its domain.

args.new_description: Stainless steels with ferritic structure, including Types 405, 409, 430, 442, and 446.
args.justification: ClsR_0ca3c51c is a family of stainless steels defined by ferritic structure; grouping under 'Stainless Steel Classification' aligns with its domain.

args.new_description: Stainless steels with martensitic structure, including Types 410, 410S, 416, 420, 440A, 440B, and 440C.
args.justification: ClsR_4ad44c21 is a family of stainless steels defined by martensitic structure; grouping under 'Stainless Steel Classification' aligns with its domain.

executed_decisions.justification: ClsC_297a52fd is overloaded, grouping distinct metallurgical structures (austenitic, ferritic, martensitic) that are already represented as separate classes; splitting clarifies schema and avoids redundancy.
ClsR_aed0d686 and SPLIT_Austenitic_Structure are duplicates, both representing the austenitic metallurgical structure with identical entity membership and description.
ClsR_ed9c5658 and SPLIT_Ferritic_Structure are duplicates, both representing the ferritic metallurgical structure with identical entity membership and description.
ClsR_423fb320 and SPLIT_Martensitic_Structure are duplicates, both representing the martensitic metallurgical structure with identical entity membership and description.
